meanings.definition: To officially exclude someone from participation in the sacraments and services of the Christian Church.
meanings.sent1: The priest excommunicated the man for his actions.
meanings.sent2: The church excommunicated the member who broke the rules.
meanings.sent3: The excommunicated person tried to attend church but was stopped at the door.
meanings.sent4: Being excommunicated felt like being locked out of a sacred place.
meanings.sent5: The act of excommunication was a severe punishment in the church community.

meanings.definition: To exclude someone from a group or community.
meanings.sent1: The club excommunicated the troublemaker to maintain peace.
meanings.sent2: The team excommunicated the player who refused to follow the rules.
meanings.sent3: The excommunicated student had to eat lunch alone.
meanings.sent4: Being excommunicated from the group made him feel isolated.
meanings.sent5: The act of excommunication was a last resort to preserve harmony.
